description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown reduction to previous points (2006 reduction) and reduce length by 2m large stem overhanging property to the rear, to One Oak T3 on TPO 307
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The Oak is situated within the back garden of 1 Deborah Crescent. This tree presents a mature and
attractive crown. Views of the crown can be gained between houses and over the roofs from
multiple angles, including Deborah Crescent, Vicarage Close and the busy Bury Street. The tree
has a Moderate amenity value, therefore making a significant positive contribution to the local
landscape and continuing the canopy cover into areas adjacent to Ruislip Village Conservation
The crown of this Oak appears healthy and in good condition. The application wish to reduce the
tree in the same way as that approved in 2006 however the wording of the application implies this is
crown shaping and crown reduction. Having assessed the 2006 application this was to reduce back
from the property by 8ft only and therefore there is some ambiguity as to the exact extent of the
work the applicant wishes to carry out.
No arboricultural reason has been provided concerning the need to complete tree work, inst
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
